page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: This block sees the meeting of urban settlement with open countryside.It is, scenically, a very attractive area in parts, particularly on the open uplands to the north and west of Walshaw and Tottington. Historically, this area belongs to the great cotton era of Lancashire: Walshaw, for example, had a flourishing cloth making and dyeing works as long ago as 1851. The River Irwell flows through part of the area; its valley having been greatly improved in recent years. Land-use is quite varied, although dominated mainly by residential zones.However industry, farming, water storage and recreation all contribute to the overall land-usage. The following pages should give the reader a taste of the various aspects of life which are found in the block.
